content: See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer I think the video is a little dated, but the details for copying and moving the files should still be valid.

content:
Can't receive it why? Is you mail provider marking it as spam and putting it in a spam folder on their mail server? Is the washington post even sending it?

You appear to think someone that is not you can effect change in your installation. That is not true. Thunderbird is software on your computer, installed and manged by you.

I have no idea what this means. "only way is to scroll way down to last known one" what happens when you find the earlier version of the post that makes it appear? Do you do something, or is the new one nested under the old one.
creator: MattAuSupport
